channel.title: == Auxy Forum Awards 2019 - Winners! ==
channel.description:
2019 was a great year yâ€™all, and some amazing talent was shown. Letâ€™s get right into the winners...
**Favorite Auxy Track of 2019** Chrysalism by @Mr_Mooo Go check out his track and his page [here!](https://soundcloud.com/mr_mooo/chrysalism)
**Favorite Auxy Producer of 2019** @MrSerpent! Go check out 2019â€™s voted Favorite producer [here!](https://soundcloud.com/misterserpent)
**Most Innovative Track of 2019**
PARADISE â€˜87 by @TC64! Go check out this spectacular track [here!](https://soundcloud.com/tc64music/paradise-87)
Last but not least... **Most Supportive Individual of 2019** Goes to... the one and only @MrSerpent! Thank you for all your love and support this year, Serp! Iâ€™d link your page again, but I think I already did it once wink wink...
Honorable mention... Shoutout to all the moms out there! I know my mother has to put up with me blaring my Auxy tracks and projects all the time, but she still listens and tells me theyâ€™re pleasant...even though they probably arenâ€™t ðŸ˜‚.
Letâ€™s make 2020 an amazing year, canâ€™t wait to see what you can come up with.

item.title: == Auxy Forum Awards 2019 - Winners! ==
item.dc:creator: MisterMaster
item.description:
Thanks to @INDIR3CT and his Mom for hosting the 2019 Auxy Forum awards and managing the nominations, polling and announcements over the Christmas period.

And congrats to the winners, with @Mr_Mooo releasing the track of the year, @MrSerpent taking out both producer of the year and most supportive forum member & @TC64 winning most innovative track. Your unicorns have all been assigned and your names added to the Unicorn Hall of Fame.

If youâ€™re not familiar with the Unicorns, theyâ€™re won via Auxy forum competitions, or by doing good things for the Auxy forum community.

Thanks to everyone who entered, nominated, voted and listened to the submissions.

Read full topic

item.description:

As for Mr. Mooo, itâ€™s awesome to see how far heâ€™s come since our first collab a few years back. Lastly, Paradise '87 was incredible and deserves a spot as well.
